abstract: The fierce reaction to the World Bank assessment of China’s state-capitalism system hints at a ferocious debate within the government as the nation prepares for a leadership transition.
snippet: The fierce reaction to the World Bank assessment of China’s state-capitalism system hints at a ferocious debate within the government as the nation prepares for a leadership transition.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — When the World Bank and a Chinese research organization called on Beijing policy makers this week to scale back the power of state-owned companies, reform-minded economists offered praise. But not everyone is pleased.

headline.main: Furor Over Report Hints at a Chinese Policy Debate
